entry.title: [Arch Linux] Failed to commit transaction (invalid or corrupted package) error
entry.summary: Got really annoyed when I run yay -Syu and encounter this error. And MORE HATE FOR MYSELF because I always forget how to fix this. That's the reason why I am here typing on my keyboard writing this post. I HAVE TO WRITE IT DOWN!
entry.content:
TL;DR

# find /var/cache/pacman/pkg/ -iname "*.part" -delete

And... WHALA!

Detail

Look for .part files (partially downloaded packages) in /var/cache/pacman/pkg/ and remove them (often caused by usage of a custom XferCommand in pacman.conf).

Some commands might help

  • pacman -Sy archlinux-keyring
  • pacman-key --refresh-keys

References

  • [SOLVED] Invalid or Corrupted package (PGP signature) / Pacman & Package Upgrade Issues / Arch Linux Forums
  • pacman - ArchWiki
